snippet: The raid lasted two days in the Sambisa Game Reserve in Borno State and left at least 18 people dead, a military spokesman said Friday.
abstract: Nigerian soldiers attack camps in game reserve in northeast Nigeria suspected of being set up to train members of radical Islamic sect Boko Haram.
lead_paragraph: The raid lasted two days in the Sambisa Game Reserve in Borno State and left at least 18 people dead, a military spokesman said Friday.

headline.main: Soldiers Raid Militants’ Camps in Nigeria, Military Says
headline.print_headline: Nigeria: Soldiers Raid Militants’ Camps, Military Says
